metadata.title: CVE-2021-3910 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
OctoRPKI crashes when encountering a repository that returns an invalid ROA(just an encoded NUL (\0) character).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

octorpki - 1.4.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cfrpki package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-1').
